alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Carter; Greenup (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 8:07PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Boyd, southern Greenup and northeastern Carter Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 807 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Greenbo Lake, or 9 miles north of Grayson, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ashland, Ironton, Cannonsburg, Kenova, Catlettsburg, Load, Princess, Coalton, Gesling, Greenbo Lake, Oldtown, Naples, Rush, Flatwoods, South Point, Russell, Raceland, Wurtland, Bellefonte and Westwood. This includes Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 173 and 190. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia.
